title: KSL.com midseason college football awards
text:
 
SALT LAKE CITY  It's been a great first-half of the season, with a lot left to be played. Here at KSL.com we've reviewed the film and have tallied the votes to determine midseason awards. 
The following is a look at some of the best players and game so far this season. Don't like who we picked? Vote in the polls and show us who you believe should be awarded for each category. 
If you can't see the poll below, click HERE . Most Valuable Player: Devontae Booker, RB, Utah Offensive Player of the Year: Devontae Booker, RB, Utah Defensive Player of the Year: Gionni Paul, LB, Utah Special Teams Player of the Year: Tom Hackett, P, Utah Freshman of the Year: Tanner Mangum, QB, BYU Most Improved Player: Travis Wilson, QB, Utah Most Surprising Player: Travis Wilson, QB, Utah Game of the Year: BYU @ Nebraska Worst Game of the Year: BYU @ Michigan 2nd Half of Season Star: Kent Myers, QB, Utah State Best Play: Mangum-to-Mathews Hail Mary Thanks for voting!
